in.tamchow.fractal.misc.primes

Class PrimeCounter

  • java.lang.Object
    • in.tamchow.fractal.misc.primes.PrimeCounter

  • public class PrimeCounter
extends java.lang.Object
    PrimeCounter - an application/library to calculate the number of prime numbers below a certain number, also mathematically known as pi(x), where x is a natural number greater than one. Uses sieves and multithreaded and optimized trial division. Timing facility is built-in. This is public domain software, licensed under the Apache License 2.0
    Since:
    2016-03-02
    Version:
    1.3
    Author:
    Tamoghna Chowdhury

    • Constructor Detail

      • PrimeCounter

        public PrimeCounter()
        Default constructor. Sets default values for the parameters. The values used are experimentally determined for best performance on the author's system.

      • PrimeCounter

        public PrimeCounter(int NUM_THREADS,
                    int LOW_LIM,
                    int SPLIT_LIM,
                    int HIGH_LIM,
                    int REDUCE_FACTOR)
        Parameterized Constructor - configures calculation parameters
        Parameters:
        NUM_THREADS - : The number of threads to be used in multithreaded trial division.
        LOW_LIM - : The minimum value of 'x' for which trial division will be used.
        SPLIT_LIM - : The value which determines how many threads will be used. NUM_THREADS
        HIGH_LIM - : The value of 'x' for which the bitPrimeSieve(long) will be used.
        REDUCE_FACTOR - : The value which determines the packing density bitPrimeSieve(long) will use.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method: accepts user input and shows total execution time taken
        Parameters:
        args - : The command-line arguments

      • sieveTest

        private static long sieveTest(long MAX)
        Private testing and timer function
        Parameters:
        MAX - : input to be passed on to primeSieve(long)
        Returns:
        The time taken for the calculation of pi(x)

      • completed

        private static boolean completed(@NotNull
                                 long[] array)
        Checks for completion of threads
        Parameters:
        array - : The array containing the completion data
        Returns:
        True if completed, false if not

      • isPrime

        private static boolean isPrime(long n)
        Checks if the parameter is prime or not. 2,3,5,7 are hardcoded as factors.
        Parameters:
        n - : the number to check for primality
        Returns:
        True if n is prime, false if not

      • primeSieve

        public long primeSieve(long MAX)
        Calculates primes using the atandard Sieve of Eratosthenes. Uses 2,3,5,7 wheel factorization for elimination (hardcoded for performance reasons)
        Parameters:
        MAX - : argument x for pi(x) Will delegate to primeCount(long) for MAX<LOW_LIM, and to bitPrimeSieve(long) for MAX>HIGH_LIM, for performance reasons.
        Returns:
        The number of prime numbers <= MAX
        See Also:
        primeCount(long), bitPrimeSieve(long)

      • primeCount

        public long primeCount(long MAX)
        Generates and counts primes using an optimized but naive iterative algorithm. Uses MultiThreading for arguments above LOW_LIM
        Parameters:
        MAX - : Argument x for pi(x), the limit to which to generate numbers.
        Returns:
        The number of prime numbers <= MAX

      • bitPrimeSieve

        public long bitPrimeSieve(long MAX)
        Calculates primes using bitmasked Sieve of Eratosthenes.
        Parameters:
        MAX - : argument x for pi(x)
        Returns:
        The number of prime numbers <= MAX
